p: Apoptosis is a highly systemized mode of cell death that is characterized by energy-dependent biochemical events and distinct morphological characteristics ( Elmore, 2007). Defective apoptotic pathways have critical role in the onset and pathogenesis of cancer, thus, induction of apoptosis is a feasible and targeted treatment in various types of cancer ( Wong, 2011). The two majorly described apoptotic pathways are extrinsic/death receptor pathways and intrinsic/mitochondrial-mediated pathway ( Baig et al., 2016). Extrinsic cellular pathway is characterized by the activation of death signaling ligands such as Fas-L (Fas ligand) ( Jan and Chaudhry, 2019). The intrinsic pathway is mediated by Bcl-2 (B-cell lymphoma 2) family members such as activation of mitochondrial membrane bounded Bax (Bcl2-associated X protein) and inactivation of Bcl-2 stimulate the discharge of cytochrome c which in turn activates initiator and effector caspases to induce the apoptosis ( Loreto et al., 2014).
